alert.note: Alert for Pennington; Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 24 at 6:30PM CDT until June 24 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR WESTERN MARSHALL...WESTERN RED LAKE...NORTHWESTERN POLK...WESTERN PENNINGTON...NORTHEASTERN GRAND FORKS AND SOUTHEASTERN WALSH COUNTIES... At 629 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Argyle to Mallory, moving east at 40 mph. At 620 PM CDT, a 62 mph gust was reported 4 north-northwest of Grand Forks. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Key West around 635 PM CDT. Euclid around 645 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Old Mill State Park, Crookston, Dorothy, Gentilly, Huot and Wylie. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 138 and 174. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
